channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Historic flooding strands hundreds in North Carolina. And, Hezbollah leader mourned
item.description: Tropical storm Helene has left western North Carolina with catastrophic damage from historic flooding to a loss of power for thousands. And, Lebanon mourning the loss of Hezbollah leader.
item.content:encoded:
Tropical storm Helene has left western North Carolina with catastrophic damage from historic flooding to a loss of power for thousands. And, Lebanon mourning the loss of Hezbollah leader.

(Image credit: Mahmous Zayyat)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Maryland seemed poised this year to legalize medical aid in dying. What happened?
item.description: Most Americans support allowing some terminally ill patients to end their own lives. But a Maryland bill’s narrow defeat shows the issue is still religiously fraught and politically delicate.
item.content:encoded:
Most Americans support allowing some terminally ill patients to end their own lives. But a Maryland bill’s narrow defeat shows the issue is still religiously fraught and politically delicate.

(Image credit: Brian Witte/AP)
item.dc:creator: Scott Maucione

item.title: Helene death toll rises to over 90 as millions remain without power
item.description: At least 91 people across several states were killed. Officials warned that rebuilding from the widespread loss of homes and property would be lengthy and difficult.
item.content:encoded:
At least 91 people across several states were killed. Officials warned that rebuilding from the widespread loss of homes and property would be lengthy and difficult.

(Image credit: Melissa Sue Gerrits)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: An NPR investigation: A murder in Hebron
item.description: Was the murder of a young Palestinian man in the West Bank an anti-gay hate crime? NPR identifies the accused killer and explores the parallel systems of justice that have yet to resolve this case.
item.content:encoded:
Was the murder of a young Palestinian man in the West Bank an anti-gay hate crime? NPR identifies the accused killer and explores the parallel systems of justice that have yet to resolve this case.

(Image credit: Oded Balilty)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Amazon India workers say they're overworked and mistreated during a brutal heat wave
item.description: Amazon India says it ensures breaks and worker safety, but workers tell NPR they're pressured not to stop for water or to use the toilet, especially while processing same-day orders.
item.content:encoded:
Amazon India says it ensures breaks and worker safety, but workers tell NPR they're pressured not to stop for water or to use the toilet, especially while processing same-day orders.

(Image credit: Dhiraj Singh)
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: Vance and Walz debate in New York City on Tuesday. Here’s what you need to know
item.description: The CBS News vice presidential debate will be the only time Ohio Sen. JD Vance and Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz get to face off ahead of the 2024 election. Here's what to expect.
item.content:encoded:
The CBS News vice presidential debate will be the only time Ohio Sen. JD Vance and Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz get to face off ahead of the 2024 election. Here's what to expect.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images; Jae Hong/AP)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: 3 women from different backgrounds detail why they're voting for Harris
item.description: Is Georgia ready to cast its 16 electoral votes for a woman for president? We put that question to three women who have lived through a few election cycles in the state.
item.content:encoded:
Is Georgia ready to cast its 16 electoral votes for a woman for president? We put that question to three women who have lived through a few election cycles in the state.

(Image credit: Nydia Blas for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: Stressed out? These 8 skills can help boost mood and reduce anxiety
item.description: Life is stressful. Whether it’s work or relationship issues or you’re worrying about politics or global conflict, it can be overwhelming. NPR’s Stress Less: A quest to reclaim your calm aims to help.
item.content:encoded: Life is stressful. Whether it’s work or relationship issues or you’re worrying about politics or global conflict, it can be overwhelming. NPR’s Stress Less: A quest to reclaim your calm aims to help.
item.dc:creator: Allison Aubrey

item.title: What Tim Walz's past debate performances reveal about how he may take on JD Vance
item.description: Those who’ve debated Walz before say he has a down-to-earth style that is relatable to voters — but it's an approach that can also cause problems for the Democratic vice presidential nominee.
item.content:encoded:
Those who’ve debated Walz before say he has a down-to-earth style that is relatable to voters — but it's an approach that can also cause problems for the Democratic vice presidential nominee.

(Image credit: Nicole Neri)
item.dc:creator: Dana Ferguson

item.title: 'The Power Broker' at 50 — and what author Robert Caro is still uncovering
item.description: Talking to historian and author Robert Caro is like stepping into a time machine, as NPR discovered on a visit to his New York office recently.
item.content:encoded:
Talking to historian and author Robert Caro is like stepping into a time machine, as NPR discovered on a visit to his New York office recently.

(Image credit: Andy Kropa/Andy Kropa/Invision/AP)
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow
